overview_of_class: In this course we will read canonical political theoretical texts, paying special attention to themes of speech, sovereignty, equality, and resistance. The assigned readings include works by Plato, Thomas Hobbes, John Locke, Karl Marx, Henry David Thoreau, and John Stuart Mill. The objective is for students to learn how to think, write, and speak critically about specific assumptions and theories used to justify or explain political preferences and laws; to learn about key historical events relevant to contemporary debates about free speech; and to understand and defend your own interpretations of political conflicts and laws.
name: Introduction to Political Theory
subject: POLI_SCI
